title: How to Enter BIOS Advanced Debug Mode on Your Acer Laptop

steps.title: Boot into the BIOS.
steps.content: Boot into the BIOS. To do this, tap F2 on your keyboard when the laptop is first restarted or powered on. [1] X Research source There is usually only a short window of time when you can enter the BIOS. If you miss it and the system starts as normal, just restart and try again.

steps.title: Force shutdown using the power button.
steps.content: Force shutdown using the power button. Hold the power button on BIOS screen till force shutdown occurs (takes around 5 seconds).

steps.title: Type the advanced mode keycode.
steps.content: Type the advanced mode keycode. While the laptop is off, press the following keys on the laptop keyboard in order: F4, 4, R, F, V, F5, 5, T, G, B, F6, 6, Y, H, N [2] X Research source

steps.title: Boot into the BIOS again.
steps.content: Boot into the BIOS again. Press the power button to start the laptop and tap F2 to boot into the BIOS again. [3] X Research source

steps.title: View the BIOS.
steps.content: View the BIOS. The BIOS will start in Advanced/Debug mode. You should now be able to see the following additional tabs which are otherwise hidden: Debug Advanced Power

steps.title: Make changes and Save.
steps.content: Make changes and Save. You can now make the changes as required, then save. On restart the BIOS will revert back to default mode.
